Nintendo 3DS

Product Overview

Enjoy incredible gaming on the go with Nintendo 3DS. With a vivid 3D screen that eliminates the need for special glasses, you’ll experience mind-blowing graphics, and stunning 3D films, with this handheld wonder. And, by using the 3D Depth Slider, you can switch to 2D. It’s up to you.

Product Details

Nintendo 3DS packs a lot into a small space. With built-in software such as Nintendo 3DS Sound, Mii Maker, StreetPass, Mii Plaza, AR Games, Activity Log, Face Raiders and more as standard, there’s always something for you to enjoy.

With glorious 3D visuals you can adjust with the 3D Depth Slider, Nintendo 3DS is a console like no other. And thanks to the 3D Camera, you can capture memories in a truly unique way. You can even record up to 10 minutes of 3D footage with the included memory card.

Discover Nintendo eShop and you can view trailers, see software rankings and purchase software, so your Nintendo 3DS can be as individual as you are. StreetPass lets you swap your game data with other users as you pass them, as long as you want to. And thanks to SpotPass, you can receive new game content, videos, trailers and news automatically, and play online with others over Wi-Fi.

What’s more anyone can enjoy Nintendo 3DS safely by using the Parental Controls feature. You can easily restrict content by the game’s rating, regulate the use of wireless connectivity, such as the internet, or turn off the 3D settings.

Key Features

  • Plays Nintendo 3DS games in 2D and steroscopic 3DS
  • Backwards compatible! - Plays Nintendo DS
  • Supports local and online multiplayer (wireless internet connection required for online play)
  • Connect to Nintendo eShop - download games & applications (wireless internet connection required)
  • StreetPass - exhanges game data with system owners you pass on the street
  • Parental Controls - manage content accessed by children

How customer reviews and ratings work

Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings, help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyses reviews to verify trustworthiness.

5.0 out of 5 stars A Portable Gaming Marvel - Nintendo 3DS Handheld Console (Aqua Blue)
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 July 2023
Style Name: Aqua BlueVerified Purchase
Introduction:
The Nintendo 3DS Handheld Console in Aqua Blue has been an absolute marvel in my gaming journey, earning a well-deserved five-star rating. This portable gaming device has seamlessly integrated cutting-edge technology with a vast library of captivating games, offering an unmatched gaming experience on the go. Join me as I share my enthusiastic appreciation for the Nintendo 3DS, highlighting its exceptional features and the joy it has brought me through beloved franchises like Mario, The Legend of Zelda, and Pokémon.

Endless Gaming Pleasures:
The Nintendo 3DS allows me to dive into a world of gaming ecstasy by enjoying not only my entire 3DS collection but also the classic DS titles. The extensive library caters to diverse preferences, ensuring that every gaming session is an adventure worth embarking upon. From immersive RPGs to thrilling action-adventures, the Nintendo 3DS delivers endless pleasures that keep me engrossed for hours on end.

3D Gaming - A Portable Spectacle:
The ability to experience 3D gaming on a handheld console has been an absolute game-changer. The Nintendo 3DS brings its titles to life with captivating depth and visuals that make every gaming moment more immersive and engaging. Whether I’m traversing the Mushroom Kingdom with Mario or embarking on a quest as Link in Hyrule, the 3D effects add an extra layer of charm to the gameplay, making each experience feel larger-than-life.

Nostalgia Meets Innovation - Iconic Franchises:
One of the highlights of owning a Nintendo 3DS is the opportunity to relish Nintendo’s iconic franchises. From the timeless adventures of Mario to the epic journeys of The Legend of Zelda and the captivating world of Pokémon, these beloved series have accompanied me on countless nostalgic adventures. The Nintendo 3DS ensures that these classic titles receive a new lease of life with enhanced graphics and intuitive gameplay features, making me fall in love with these cherished characters all over again.

Customizable Parental Controls:
As a parent, I greatly appreciate the customizable parental controls feature of the Nintendo 3DS. It allows me to ensure a safe gaming environment for my children, granting me peace of mind knowing that they can explore the gaming world responsibly. The ability to set time limits, restrict access to certain content, and monitor their activities is a fantastic addition that caters to the needs of modern-day parents.

Versatility with Updated Versions:
Nintendo has continued to innovate, offering updated versions of the handheld console to suit diverse preferences. The Nintendo 2DS caters to those seeking a more affordable option without compromising on the gaming experience, while the Nintendo New 3DS XL boasts improved performance and larger screens for a more immersive gameplay experience. The versatility of these updated versions allows gamers to choose the console that best suits their gaming preferences and budget.

Conclusion - A Gaming Treasure:
The Nintendo 3DS Handheld Console in Aqua Blue has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. Its extensive library of games, 3D gaming capabilities, and seamless integration of beloved franchises have made it a gaming treasure that never fails to delight. The customizable parental controls add an extra layer of reassurance, making it suitable for gamers of all ages. As Nintendo continues to innovate with updated versions, I am confident that this handheld console will remain an enduring source of joy and entertainment for gaming enthusiasts worldwide. Without a doubt, the Nintendo 3DS earns a well-deserved five-star rating and holds a special place in my heart as a true gaming marvel.

Bexie
5.0 out of 5 stars Love it.
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2012
Style Name: Aqua BlueVerified Purchase
As a bonkers Nintendo fangirl and collector for the past 20 years, I pre-ordered this and got it on release. For several months, however, it did just sit there, virtually unused.

But then the GOOD games started appearing. :D

The first game I actually got for my 3DS was Ocarina of Time 3D, three months after this came out, and I finally got to see the 3D in action properly.
The 3D is actually pretty good - obviously you just have to make sure to hold the console in the right position, otherwise you'll get a weird double image. It can be quite impressive, although sometimes when I have the 3D on I feel like my eyes are crossing to try and focus on it properly - I find having the slider turned up about halfway is just about right.
However, I actually think games look better with the 3D turned OFF. The lines are much clearer and the console really does have some smashing graphics. I now usually only turn on the 3D for cutscenes.

Since Ocarina of Time, I've bought Star Fox, Mario Kart, and Super Mario 3D Land. You can really appreciate the 3D on Mario, it's actually fantastic.

And then there's the Virtual Console. This was what I was most excited for the 3DS for - being able to download old Gameboy, Gameboy Colour, and Game Boy Advance games, just like you can download old console games on the Wii. For quite a long time, releases on the VC seemed slow, but they've been picking up recently and there are some cracking titles available to download, like Zelda: Link's Awakening, Kirby, Wario Land, and Super Mario Land: 6 Golden Coins, amongst others. The games are all reasonably priced (between around £3.60 and £5.40ish, depending on the game), and being older games, don't take up much space at all on the SD card, so you can cram it full of golden oldies.
Any old SD card will work with the 3DS, and one comes free with the console, unlike some consoles that are only compatible with overpriced memory cards made by the same company (*cough*Vita*cough*) You can top up the amount of cash to download games either by debit card, or by purchasing an eshop card from a shop (NOT a Nintendo points card! Must be an eshop card).
You can also download all the DSiWare stuff on your 3DS, too.

Plus, there are game videos you can download, AND game demos, so you can try out some games before you buy them.

Have a DSi? Want a 3DS? Have purchased DSiWare that you'd like to keep on your 3DS? No problem. Nintendo have added a simple to use Data Transfer system, which you can use to transfer EVERYTHING from a DSi over to your shiny new 3DS, or even from 3DS to 3DS. Absolutely everything is transferred, and afterwards the console that had been transferred from is reset to factory settings.
I myself used the Data transfer system when I bought a different 3DS (The limited edition Zelda one... it's so shiny) and needed to transfer the stuff I had already downloaded from my old 3DS. I can confirm that it really is easy to use - it's completely fool-proof - and it really does transfer everything - VC downloads, saves, etc.
If there are people here who, like me, bought the 3DS on release and as a result got the 20 free Ambassador games, and you'd like a new 3DS (there are more pretty limited edition ones coming!), rest assured, the system transfer does transfer your Ambassador status and your free games. :)

In all, this is a great console. Yeah, the 3D can be a bit gimmicky at times, but it does work well, and you can turn it off whenever you like. Now that it has a better games library, it's much more fun, and the Virtual console is just great. Plus with great upcoming games like Kid Icarus: Uprising (It looks amazing!), Luigi's Mansion 2, and Fire Emblem (confirmed for Europe!), it's going to get even better. The price reduction last August makes it even more of a must buy - I paid £180 for mine on release, which was about as cheap as you could get. It's dropped very significantly since!
But at least I have my 20 free games to make up for the price-drop. Cheers Ninty! :D
